summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys discussing the lack of response from Jeffrey Epstein's lawyers regarding case deadlines. It shows internal communication within the U.S. Attorney's Office in West Palm Beach about the Epstein case in December 2007.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: Email recipient and sender; appears to be coordinating communication about the Epstein case and mentions receiving something to send out.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Author of emails inquiring about response from Epstein's lawyers and offering to revise a letter regarding deadlines.

connections.description: Colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office communicating about the Epstein case and coordinating on correspondence.

events.title: Internal Email Discussion on Epstein Case
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys exchange emails about the lack of response from Epstein's lawyers and discuss revising a letter to inform them of deadlines.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400 West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Internal DOJ email communication from December 2007 shows U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta was directly involved in correspondence about the Epstein case.
The emails indicate frustration that Epstein's lawyers were staying quiet and not responding.
The correspondence discusses revising a letter to inform Epstein's legal team about case deadlines.
The emails originate from the U.S. Attorney's Office in West Palm Beach, Florida, where the Epstein case was being handled.
